ngiemboon: Wɔɔn ée nkʉ̀ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la túmo Malashʉ ngie à gʉa ńtsẅii mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ.

Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn né pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ngie: «Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a n kwoŋo gẅí.» Táʼ pi ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́ɔn ngie: «Ammó gie á nyɛɛ ngie ɔ̀ kwoŋo wég áa kɔ́?» N ne ńzɛ́te gẅí yɔ́ɔn ngie: «Ezagẅi la te fɛ̌ Yakwɔ̂b wɔ́ le? Táʼ, anò Yakwɔ̂b la kúu twó mèŋ,
en: “I have loved you,”   says the Lord.

ngiemboon: ńcʉa ye Ezagẅi. Epʉ̀a Ezagẅi tsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ pàga láʼa mekwɛ́ gie n da sele ńdɔg ńgÿo nkùɔmekwaʼá, ḿbiŋ sẅéen ngwòŋ wɔ́b ńná né ngwètsẅɛ.
en: but I hated Esau.   I turned his mountains into a wasteland, and gave his inheritance to the desert jackals.”  # 1:3 Is 34:5–17; Jr 49:7–22; Ezk 35:1–15

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Éndɔ̀m lɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: “Mé ka tág metÿǒsoŋ még, táʼ, peg ge gíŋe kwɛ́ sẅesẅé!” Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: “Pɔ́ lɔɔn ńkwɛ́, mbà n ge gíŋe tág.” Mé ge gÿo tóŋo wɔ́b lê: “Aláʼa pʉ̀a tepòŋ, mbɔɔ lê pʉ̀a pie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a aa fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm ne ńgyáŋa pɔ́ lóŋ né pɔ́b.”
en: Though Edom says, “We have been devastated, but we will rebuild   the ruins,” the Lord of Armies says this: “They may build, but I will demolish. They will be called a wicked country  # 1:4 Mal 3:12,15 and the people the Lord has cursed  # 1:4 Or Lord is angry with forever.  # 1:4 Is 34:5–17; Jr 49:17–18; Mal 1:14; 2:2; 3:9; 4:6

ngiemboon: Pi pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, pi ge gyá púʼu, é gɔɔn ngie: “Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅiin ngʉ̀ʼ, tà mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ mengwòŋ mie é té me pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ wɔ́.”»
en: Your own eyes will see this, and you yourselves will say, ‘The Lord is great, even beyond   the borders of Israel.’  # 1:5 Ps 67:1–7; 72:8–11; Ezk 39:7; Zch 12:1–10; Rm 11:11–12

ngiemboon: «Múɔ ná mekùʼ tá we, angàŋafàʼ ná mekùʼ táfàʼ we. Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ n gee tá, mbà mekùʼ mɔ́ɔn ee nzɔ̌? Ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ n gee táfàʼ, mbà lepɔgɔ́ wɔ́ɔn aa nzɔ̌? Cʉ̀apʉ̀a é Ssé gie e piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ zɔ gɔɔn. Ńgʉa na pi panuŋepwɔʼ pie pi gwága lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn tà ńzɛ́te ngie: “Peg lɔgɔ́ kɔ́ ńgwág lezíŋ shú?”
en: “A son honors his father, and a servant his master. But if I am a father, where is my honor? And if I am a master, where is your fear of me?   says the Lord of Armies to you priests, who despise my name.”

ngiemboon: Pi lɔg shúm sie ncÿǒ ée mǒ ńtó nuŋe ndùm jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ yɔ́ɔn, ńzɛ́te ngie: “Peg lɔgɔ́ kɔ́ ńnéŋ ncÿǒ na gù?” Pi lɔgɔ púʼu ńgɔɔn ngie jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gwɔ́ pɔ́ mmó gie ngwɔ́ mé gwág gwǎg.
en: “By presenting defiled food on my altar.”

ngiemboon: Pi lɔgɔ nɔ̀ɔn gẅie aa fʉ̀ ńnuŋe pwɔʼ mvfò mèŋ péʼe, á gwɔ́ mbòŋ púʼu? Ńdɔgɔ nɔ̀ɔn gẅie aa pwɔ̀ʼɔ kwò kà pɔ́ gẅie aa nguɔ wɔ́ɔ, ńnuŋe pwɔʼ mvfò mèŋ péʼe, á gwɔ́ mbòŋ púʼu? Pi lɔɔn ńnáa mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à sáʼa pàga láʼ gí, mbà nò ge poŋo yé? Mbà à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ á lɔgɔ pòŋontʉ́m ńkẅé gẅí? Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ zɔ zɛ́te.
en: “When you present a blind animal for sacrifice, is it not wrong? And when you present a lame or sick animal, is it not wrong?   Bring it to your governor! Would he be pleased with you or show you favor? ” asks the Lord of Armies.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie pi sẅíŋte wɔ́ɔn. Á wɔ́ɔn gẅie n gee Ssé gi, légwɔ́ gie n tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mí. Tà à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ pi fʉʼ nò pɛ́ʼɛ̀, n kẅé gẅí mboŋó lêkɔ́? Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ zɔ zɛ́te.
en: “And now plead for God’s favor. Will he be gracious to us?   Since this has come from your hands, will he show any of you favor? ”  # 1:9 Nm 6:25–26 asks the Lord of Armies.

ngiemboon: Mvfò kaa páʼ ngwɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ na pi jÿɔ́ʼ ncwò ndá Ssé. Légwɔ́ gie pi te gʉa ndùm jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ yɔ́ɔn, é nyɛte mmɔ̌g sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́. Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, n ne ńdíe gẅí pɛ́ʼɛ̀ anò gí té ne ḿboŋo wɔ́ɔn mɔ́, mbɔɔ shúm pwɔʼ sie pi lɔgɔ ńtóo ńnáa né mèŋ, é te ne ḿboŋo wɔ́ɔn mɔ́.
en: “I wish one of you would shut the temple doors,   so that you would no longer kindle a useless fire on my altar!  # 1:10 Pr 1:17; Is 1:14 I am not pleased with you,” says the Lord of Armies, “and I will accept  # 1:10 Lv 22:19–21 no offering from your hands.  # 1:10 Is 1:10–17; Jr 6:20; Am 5:21–23; Mc 6:6–8

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tsɔ́ mengwòŋ, léfó na yɔɔn ndège tsetsáʼ ńgʉa ńkú gi, é zsé ngie n gẅiin ngʉ̀ʼ. Pɔ́ ée jʉʼ ntsèm ńtuɔ lìi, ńtí lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn, ḿbiŋe ńnáa shúm pwɔʼ sie é té ncÿǒ gẅiin né mèŋ. Epʉ̀a tsɔ́ mengwòŋ zsé ngie n gẅiin ngʉ̀ʼ, mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ zɔ gɔɔn.
en: “My name will be great among the nations,   from the rising of the sun to its setting. Incense  # 1:11 Or Burnt offerings and pure offerings will be presented in my name in every place because my name will be great among the nations,”  # 1:11 Or is great . . . are presented . . . is great says the Lord of Armies.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pi ne ńgɔɔn ngie: “Ncÿǒ ée na jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ammó léjÿó gie á kẅɛɛ jʉʼó té kuʼu tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́!” Pi gɔɔn púʼu, ńdɔgɔ ńzoonte wɔ́ɔn.
en: “But you are profaning it   when you say, ‘The Lord’s table is defiled, and its product, its food, is contemptible.’

ngiemboon: Pi gǐŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: “Yêe yɔɔn ntí faʼa metsẅiŋ le!” Pi ne ńzoonte wɔ́ɔn, á mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ! Pi lɔg menɔ̀ɔn pie pi jʉ̌ʉ, lâ pie ée pwɔ̀ʼɔ kwò, mbɔɔ pie é ne ńguɔ, ńtó ńná né mèŋ. Tà à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ n zẅíŋ mɔɔn mepwɔʼ ŋwɛ́ mie pi náa né mèŋ la?
en: You also say, ‘Look, what a nuisance! ’ And you scorn   it,”  # 1:13 Alt Hb tradition reads me,# 1:13 1Sm 2:29 says the Lord of Armies. “You bring stolen,  # 1:13 Or injured,# 1:13 2Sm 24:24 lame, or sick animals. You bring this as an offering! Am I to accept that from your hands? ” asks the Lord.

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó ngàŋ mepɔ̀b gẅie à gẅiin menɔ̀ɔn mbòŋo tsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ menɔ̀ɔn pé, ḿbiŋ ḿbÿé ngie à ge gʉa mǒ, é náa gẅie aa te ncÿǒ, é lɔg nuŋe pwɔʼ; ḿbiŋ cʉ́ʼ nzsòzsò, ńnáa nɔ̀ɔn gẅie à gẅiin lɔ̌ʼ! Táʼ, Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: N gee máamáa fùɔ gẅie pʉ̀a metsèm pɔ́g ngʉ̀ʼ ye.»
en: “The deceiver is cursed who has an acceptable male in his flock and makes a vow but sacrifices a defective animal to the Lord.   For I am a great King,” says the Lord of Armies, “and my name will be feared among the nations.
